intro: Dendrophthora tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and has a distinctive appearance with small, leathery leaves and white, tubular flowers. The plant lacks chlorophyll and relies on its host for nutrients, while also producing berries that are dispersed by birds. Its unique botanical features make it an important component of forest ecosystems. It is often found in the canopy, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
